name: Next of Kin/Associated Parties
description: The NK1 segment contains information about the patient's next of kin, emergency contacts, and other associated parties. This segment is repeatable to allow multiple contacts with different relationships and roles.

cardinality.note: NK1 segments are optional and repeatable for multiple contacts

NK1.1.name: Set ID - NK1
NK1.1.description: This field uniquely identifies the NK1 records for the purpose of adding, changing, or deleting records. For the first NK1 segment, this should be 1; for the second, 2; etc.
NK1.1.generationHint: Sequential number starting from 1 for each NK1 segment

NK1.2.name: Name
NK1.2.description: This field contains the name of the next of kin or associated party. Uses extended person name format with family name, given name, middle name, suffix, prefix, and degree components.

NK1.3.name: Relationship
NK1.3.description: This field defines the actual personal relationship that the next of kin has to the patient. Values from user-defined table 0063 - relationship.
NK1.3.generationHint: Most common: SPO (spouse), CHD (child), PAR (parent), SIB (sibling)

NK1.4.name: Address
NK1.4.description: This field contains the address of the next of kin/associated party. Multiple addresses are allowed for the same person.

NK1.5.name: Phone Number
NK1.5.description: This field contains the telephone number of the next of kin/associated party. Multiple phone numbers are allowed. The primary telephone number must be sent in the first sequence.

NK1.6.name: Business Phone Number
NK1.6.description: This field contains the business telephone number of the next of kin/associated party. Multiple business phone numbers are allowed.
NK1.6.generationHint: Format similar to NK1.5 but for business/work phone numbers

NK1.7.name: Contact Role
NK1.7.description: This field contains the contact role that defines the relationship of the person described in this segment to the patient being referred. Values from user-defined table 0131.
NK1.7.generationHint: Common roles: EP (emergency contact), N (next-of-kin), CP (contact person)

NK1.8.name: Start Date
NK1.8.description: This field contains the date from which this next of kin record is effective. Used for tracking changes in contact information over time.

NK1.9.name: End Date
NK1.9.description: This field contains the date until which this next of kin record is effective. Used for tracking changes in contact information over time.
NK1.9.generationHint: Format: YYYYMMDD, should be after NK1.8 start date

NK1.10.name: Next of Kin/Associated Parties Job Title
NK1.10.description: This field contains the job title of the next of kin/associated party. Used for identification and contact purposes.
NK1.10.generationHint: Free text job title, e.g., 'Registered Nurse', 'Software Engineer', 'Teacher'

NK1.11.name: Next of Kin/Associated Parties Job Code/Class
NK1.11.description: This field contains the job code or class of the next of kin/associated party. Uses coded values for standardized job classification.

NK1.12.name: Next of Kin/Associated Parties Employee Number
NK1.12.description: This field contains the employee number of the next of kin/associated party if they are employed by the same organization as the patient or healthcare facility.

NK1.13.name: Organization Name - NK1
NK1.13.description: This field contains the name of the organization with which the next of kin/associated party is associated. Used when the contact is an organization rather than an individual.

NK1.14.name: Marital Status
NK1.14.description: This field contains the marital status of the next of kin/associated party. Values from user-defined table 0002 - marital status.
NK1.14.generationHint: Common status: M (married), S (single), D (divorced), W (widowed)

NK1.15.name: Administrative Sex
NK1.15.description: This field contains the administrative sex of the next of kin/associated party. Values from HL7 Table 0001 - administrative sex.

NK1.16.name: Date/Time of Birth
NK1.16.description: This field contains the date and time of birth of the next of kin/associated party. Used for identification and contact verification purposes.
NK1.16.generationHint: Format: YYYYMMDDHHMMSS, often just date portion used: YYYYMMDD

NK1.17.name: Living Dependency
NK1.17.description: This field indicates the living dependency status of the next of kin/associated party with respect to the patient. Values from user-defined table 0223.
NK1.17.generationHint: Indicates dependency relationship: S (spouse), C (children), M (medical)

NK1.18.name: Ambulatory Status
NK1.18.description: This field indicates the ambulatory status of the next of kin/associated party. Values from user-defined table 0009 - ambulatory status.
NK1.18.generationHint: Usually A0 (no limitations) or empty unless contact has special needs

NK1.19.name: Citizenship
NK1.19.description: This field contains the citizenship information of the next of kin/associated party. Values from user-defined table 0171 - citizenship.

NK1.20.name: Primary Language
NK1.20.description: This field contains the primary language spoken by the next of kin/associated party. Values from user-defined table 0296 - primary language.
NK1.20.generationHint: Use ISO 639 language codes: en^English^ISO639, es^Spanish^ISO639

conditional.NK1.2: Should be provided for individual contacts

relationships.NK1.1: Must be sequential across multiple NK1 segments
relationships.NK1.8_NK1.9: End date must be after start date if both present
relationships.NK1.3_NK1.7: Relationship and contact role should be complementary

validation.NK1.3: Must be valid user-defined table 0063 relationship code
validation.NK1.7: Must be valid user-defined table 0131 contact role code
validation.NK1.14: Must be valid user-defined table 0002 marital status code
validation.NK1.15: Must be valid HL7 Table 0001 administrative sex code
